item.title: Lifting of Scottish coronavirus lockdown 'likely to be phased'
item.description: A Scottish government paper on plans to lift the virus lockdown warns life will not return to normal for some time.

item.title: Knife crime in England and Wales rises to record high, ONS figures show
item.description: Police in England and Wales recorded 45,627 offences in 2019, the Office for National Statistics says.

item.title: Coronavirus: Study to track infection and immunity levels
item.description: The findings will help to inform the government's strategy for easing the lockdown.

item.title: Coronavirus: The parents in lockdown with violent children
item.description: When your own child is a danger to you, how do you endure the isolation of social distancing?

item.title: Coronavirus: Prince Louis' rainbow tribute in second birthday pictures
item.description: The young prince, who turns two on Thursday, joins UK children making rainbow posters during lockdown.

item.title: Coronavirus: Boris Johnson was 'just another patient' - New Zealand nurse
item.description: Ms McGee said she was "shocked" to be named by the PM, who "needed" to be in intensive care.

item.title: Coronavirus: Pressure to give businesses 'hope' in lockdown
item.description: A senior Tory MP says the government must discuss a return to normality or risk companies folding.

item.title: Coronavirus: How will the developing world cope?
item.description: There is growing concern about the impact the virus will have on poorer countries.

item.title: Coronavirus: UK borrowing to see 'colossal increase' to fight virus
item.description: The deficit will hit levels not seen in peacetime, says the head of the Institute for Fiscal Studies.

item.title: Coronavirus: Isle of Wight care workers live in tents
item.description: The Victoria House Care Home on the Isle of Wight now has a policy of "no one in and no one out".

item.title: Coronavirus: 'Murder threats' to telecoms engineers over 5G
item.description: Key workers reveal the abuse they've received while working on the UK's communications networks.

item.title: Phil Neville: England women's boss to leave role next summer
item.description: Phil Neville is to leave his role as England women's manager next summer.

item.title: Big Night In: Doctor Who stars past and present unite for BBC charity show
item.description: Doctors from the past 50 years will appear on the star-studded fundraising telethon later.

item.title: Coronavirus: How to cut your own hair at home in lockdown
item.description: From fringe to fades to caring for afro hair - these tips will help you stay tidy in lockdown.

item.title: Postman delivers 'somewhere in Sheffield' parcel
item.description: The package, containing chocolate bars, was sent from Sweden with only biographical details on the front.

item.title: Officer makes it to daughter's birth after Covid-19 test fast-tracked
item.description: PC Joe Burrows made it to he hospital a few hours before Georgiana was born.

item.title: Coronavirus lockdown: Living with my parents under new house rules
item.description: Madeleine, 22, shows us what life is like for a college student who has moved back in with her parents.

item.title: Coronavirus: Health claims debunked
item.description: Beware of false claims about 5G, inhaling steam, skin colour and vaccines.

item.title: Sex, Disability, and Sex and Disability
item.description: Disability and sex is a topic around which there are a lot of misconceptions, but what do disabled people think when people get awkward talking about sex with them?

item.title: Book recommendations from today's top selling authors
item.description: Five authors, including Margaret Atwood and Adam Kay, tell BBC arts editor Will Gompertz what their go-to books are for lockdown.

item.title: Coronavirus: £58m EuroMillions winner's social distancing celebrations
item.description: Ryan Hoyle says he had a beer 2m apart with his brothers to "get over the shock" of his lottery win.

item.title: The Papers: 'Glimmer of light' but social distancing to continue
item.description: Suggestions coronavirus has peaked in the UK and a warning social distancing will continue for the rest of 2020 lead the papers.

item.title: Coronavirus: Grandmas' top tips to get through lockdown
item.description: We've asked Grannies from around the world for their advice on staying positive.

item.title: Coronavirus: Preparing for a Ramadan under lockdown
item.description: Key workers like Dr Kiran Rahim may be unable to fast this year due to the intensity of their work.

item.title: Coronavirus: Can my boss make me return to work? And other questions
item.description: Does the UK have reusable protective equipment and other coronavirus questions answered by BBC experts.

item.title: Coronavirus: Should I start taking vitamin D?
item.description: Some people might want to consider it during the pandemic. Here's why.

item.title: Coronavirus: Heads say 1 June earliest realistic school opening
item.description: A practical timetable for reopening schools is unlikely to mean this half term, say head teachers.

item.title: Rina Sawayama: Turning familial pain into pop gold
item.description: How one of the year's catchiest pop albums started out as a dissertation on intergenerational pain.

item.title: Developing world economies hit hard by coronavirus
item.description: The Covid-19 pandemic is badly damaging developing countries' economies in a number of ways.

item.title: Coronavirus: Stories of unemployment, fear and hope in the US
item.description: The unemployment figures are staggering - but there's a human story behind each of the numbers too.

item.title: Women's European Championship: Uefa move tournament to July 2022
item.description: The postponed 2021 Women's European Championship will take place from 6-31 July 2022, Uefa confirms.

item.title: 'I want to put a smile on people's faces' - Leclerc on being a lockdown sim racing star
item.description: Even Ferrari's F1 drivers feel constrained by the lockdown, but Charles Leclerc wants to give people something to enjoy.

item.title: 'This is it, this is the biggest moment of my life' - what's it like to go through the NFL draft?
item.description: British-born NFL players Osi Umenyiora, Menelik Watson and Jack Crawford on the life-changing moment of being drafted.

item.title: Premier League matches could be free-to-air once season restarts
item.description: The Premier League "considering" making some behind-closed-doors fixtures available free-to-air when the season restarts, the culture secretary says.

item.title: Coronavirus: Should we all be wearing face masks now?
item.description: There is growing discussion about the potential benefits of the general public wearing masks.

item.title: Coronavirus: Why are international comparisons difficult?
item.description: Should you be comparing Covid-19 statistics between countries?

item.title: Coronavirus UK map: How many confirmed cases are there in your area?
item.description: Key graphics explaining how coronavirus has spread in the UK and the government's response.

item.title: Coronavirus: What it does to the body
item.description: What is it like to have the coronavirus, how will it affect you and how is it treated?

item.title: Coronavirus vaccine: When will we have one?
item.description: We answer some of the big questions about vaccines and how long one for coronavirus could take.

item.title: Coronavirus: Testing and why it matters
item.description: What are the tests for coronavirus and how do they work?

item.title: Coronavirus pandemic: Tracking the global outbreak
item.description: Key maps and charts explaining how the respiratory virus has spread around the world and how it is being dealt with.

item.title: Coronavirus: What are social distancing and self-isolation rules?
item.description: Everybody should be avoiding non-essential contact, and you should stay at home wherever possible.

item.title: Coronavirus: The world in lockdown in maps and charts
item.description: With more than a million coronavirus cases confirmed worldwide, an analysis of the world in lockdown.

item.title: Coronavirus: What do all the terms mean?
item.description: Use our tool to check the meaning of key words and phrases associated with the Covid-19 outbreak

item.title: What is the coronavirus?
item.description: Everything you need to know about the coronavirus – explained in just one minute.

item.title: Coronavirus death rate: What are the chances of dying?
item.description: The current best guess of a 1% death rate does not apply to everyone.

item.title: Coronavirus: When will the outbreak end and life get back to normal?
item.description: The huge challenge the world faces to find an exit strategy to end the lockdowns and return to normal.

item.title: Coronavirus: 'How I'm coping with self-isolation'
item.description: With the impact that coronavirus is having on our daily lives, people are finding new ways to fill their free time.

item.title: Coronavirus: 'I'm begging you, please be careful'
item.description: A woman being treated for coronavirus has made an appeal for people to stay home.

item.title: Coronavirus update: Why does staying at home help?
item.description: After Boris Johnson brings in new measures, the BBC explains why staying in is a matter of life and death.

item.title: Coronavirus: How to wash your hands - in 20 seconds
item.description: Dr Adele McCormick from the University of Westminster demonstrates how to wash your hands.

item.title: Coronavirus information: What should I do?
item.description: Step-by-step, what to do to help prevent the spread of the virus.

item.title: Coronavirus symptoms: What are they and how do I protect myself?
item.description: Prime Minister Boris Johnson is among those to be treated in hospital for the symptoms of Covid-19.

item.title: Coronavirus: More myths to ignore
item.description: Reality Check tackles misleading health advice being shared online.

item.title: The workers braving coronavirus
item.description: From supermarkets to warehouses to pharmacies, these are the people keeping things running.

item.title: The volunteer army helping self-isolating neighbours
item.description: The coronavirus outbreak has left many feeling trapped indoors, but for some help may not be far away.

item.title: Coronavirus: The rough sleepers who can't self-isolate
item.description: With soup kitchens closing and hostels 'like a Petri dish', homeless people are scared about the future.

item.title: Eliud Kipchoge: The humble home life in rural Kenya behind remarkable athletic success
item.description: Witnessing Eliud Kipchoge's humble home life in rural Kenya sheds light on some of the secrets behind his remarkable athletic success.

item.title: Afghanistan: The detention centre for teenage Taliban members
item.description: The Afghan detention centre houses some 300 boys under 18, of whom half are alleged to be militants.
